item.title: VPN
item.description: VPN basics Virtual Private Networks (VPN) create secure channels between two endpoints over an untrusted network (e.g. the Internet). There is generally a setup phase, followed by the tunneling phase. Typical properties are authentication of the other endpoint (e.g. with MACs), confidentiality (usually based on symmetric crypto), and some sort of replay suppresion (i.e. sequence numbers). Common Setups: site-to-site (e.g. regional office) host-to-site (e.g. home office) secure proxy (e.g. to circumvent censorship) Great variety of implementations:
